name: Hyper-V Virtual Machine Persistent Memory Device
summary: Learn about .VHDPMEM files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Hyper-V allows users to run multiple operating systems as virtual machines in Windows. It also allows users to create and manage virtualized software and hardware components. A VHDPMEM file is a virtualized hardware component.

Specifically, a VHDPMEM file contains a virtual persistent memory (aka storage class memory or NVDIMM) device. Hyper-V users create VHDPMEM files using the New-VHD cmdlet. During the creation process, the user can specify the device's size.
NOTE: The Windows Server 2016 and higher and Windows 10 and higher versions of Hyper-V support VHDPMEM files.

instructions: VHDPEM files are not meant to be opened. To attach a VHDPEM file to a Hyper-V virtual machine, use the Add=VMHardDiskDrive cmdlet.
